alert.note: Alert for Onondaga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 12:43PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Cayuga and Onondaga Counties through 130 PM EDT... At 1243 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Skaneateles, or 7 miles east of Auburn, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Onondaga, Syracuse, Cicero, Auburn, De Witt, Van Buren, Pompey, North Syracuse, Solvay and Manlius. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 90 between 34A and 39. New York Interstate 81 between 15 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
